tr.td: The single medical diagnosis that is most relevant to the patient's chief complaint or need for treatment.
Required when other conditions coexist or develop subsequently during the treatment
Required when an external cause of injury is needed to describe the injury
Identifies the patient's reason for the outpatient institutional visit

title.value: C4BB Claim Outpatient Institutional Diagnosis Type

description.value: Indicates if the outpatient institutional diagnosis is principal, other, an external cause of injury or a patient reason for visit.

description.value:
The Value Set is a combination of two Code Systems: CPT (HCPCS I) and HCPCS II procedure code modifiers. Modifiers help further describe a procedure code without changing its definition. CPT codes are available by subscription from the AMA at http://www.ama-assn.org/go/cpt. HCPCS codes are available at http://www.cms.gov/Medicare/Coding/HCPCSReleaseCodeSets. The link takes one to a list of files. The target set for this Code System is the procedure code modifiers from this file.
**MODIFIER CODES ONLY**

As HL7 is working with the owning authorities to finalize the urls, the urls are subject to change.

description.value: Place of Service Codes are two-digit codes placed on health care professional claims to indicate the setting in which a service was provided.

copyright.value: The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) maintain Place Of Service (POS) codes used throughout the US health care industry.

div.style: border: black 1px dotted; background-color: #EEEEEE; padding: 8px; margin-bottom: 8px

tr.td: The total submitted amount for the claim or group or line item.
Amount of the change which is considered for adjudication.
Amount deducted from the eligible amount prior to adjudication.
The amount the insured individual pays, as a set percentage of the cost of covered medical services, as an out-of-pocket payment to the provider. Example: Insured pays 20% and the insurer pays 80%.
The portion of the cost of this service that was deemed not eligible by the insurer because the service or member was not covered by the subscriber contract.
The reduction in the payment amount to reflect the carrier as a secondary payor.
The amount paid by the patient at the point of service.
The amount paid to the provider.
The amount of the member's liability.
Price paid for the drug excluding mfr or other discounts. It typically is the sum of the following components: ingredient cost, dispensing fee, sales tax, and vaccine administration

description.value: Describes the various amount fields used when payers receive and adjudicate a claim. It includes the values defined in http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/adjudication, as well as those defined in the C4BB Adjudication CodeSystem.

copyright.value: This Valueset is not copyrighted.

description.value: The National Council for Prescription Drug Programs, (NCPDP) Reject Code (511-FB) code set contains exception definitions for use when transaction processing cannot be completed.

copyright.value: NCPDP codes are available by subscription at ncpdp.org. As HL7 is working with the owning authority to finalize the url, this url is subject to change.

p.style: border: black 1px dotted; background-color: #EEEEEE; padding: 8px; margin-bottom: 8px

div.p: Expansion based on C4BB Supporting Info Type v0.1.4 (CodeSystem)

tr.td: Dates corresponding with the admission and discharge of the beneficiary to a facility
UB-04 Source of Admission (FL-15) identifies the place where the patient was identified as needing admission to a facility.
UB-04 Priority of the admission (FL-14) indicates, for example, an admission type of elective indicates that the patient's condition permitted time for medical services to be scheduled.
Indicates that the Billing Provider has a contract with the Payer as of the effective date of service or admission.
NCPDP code indicating whether the plan adjudicated the claim as a brand or generic drug.
Date the claim was received by the payer.
NCPDP code indicating whether or not the prescription is a compound.
NCPDP code indicating the prescriber's instruction regarding substitution of generic equivalents or order to dispense the specific prescribed medication.
NCPDP value indicating the Number of days supply of medication dispensed by the pharmacy.
UB-04 Discharge Status (FL-17) indicates the patient’s status as of the discharge date for a facility stay.
DRG (Diagnosis Related Group), including the code system, the DRG version and the code value
Indicates that the Performing Provider has a contract with the Payer as of the effective date of service or admission.
NCPDP value indicating the number fill of the current dispensed supply (0, 1, 2, etc.)
NCPDP code indicating whether the prescription was transmitted as an electronic prescription, by phone, by fax, or as a written paper copy.
The facility where the service occurred. Examples include hospitals, nursing homes, laboratories or homeless shelters.
UB-04 Type of Bill (FL-04) provides specific information for payer purposes.

description.value: Used as the discriminator for the types of supporting information for the CARIN IG for Blue Button� Implementation Guide.

Any benefit payable will be paid to a third party such as a guarrantor.

The Value Set is a combination of two Code Systems: CPT (HCPCS I) and HCPCS II procedure code modifiers. Modifiers help further describe a procedure code without changing its definition. description.value: This value set defines two sets of DRGs, MS-DRGs (Medicare Severity Diagnosis Related Groups) and APR-DRGs (All Patient Refined Diagnosis Related Groups). MS-DRGs are owned by CMS; APR-DRGs are owned by 3M. Assignment of a DRG is defined by a particular set of patient attributes, which include principal diagnosis, specific secondary diagnoses, procedures, sex and discharge status. Identifying a DRG code requires a version.

copyright.value: The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) maintain the MS-DRGs used throughout the US health care industry. Use of APR-DRGs require a license. Reference https://www.3m.com/3M/en_US/health-information-systems-us/drive-value-based-care/patient-classification-methodologies/apr-drgs/. As HL7 is working with the owning authorities to finalize the urls, the urls are subject to change.

Other disorders of the nervous system

description.value: The ICD-CM (International Classification of Diseases, Clinical Modification) is a system used by physicians and other healthcare providers to classify and code all diagnoses and symptoms recorded in conjunction with hospital care in the United States.

copyright.value: ICD-9 and ICD-10 are copyrighted by the World Health Organization (WHO) which owns and publishes the classification. See https://www.who.int/classifications/icd/en. WHO has authorized the development of an adaptation of ICD-9 and ICD-10 to ICD-9-CM to ICD-10-CM for use in the United States for U.S. government purposes. As HL7 is working with the owning authority to finalize the urls, the urls are subject to change.

title.value: X12 Claim Adjustment Reason Codes (CARC) - CMS- Remittance Advice Remark Codes (RARC)

description.value: The Value Set is a combination of two sets of codes: X12 Claim Adjustment Reason Codes (CARC) and CMS Remittance Advice Remark Codes (RARC). CARC codes describe why a claim or service line was paid differently than it was billed. RARC codes provide additional explanation for an adjustment already described by a Claim Adjustment Reason Code (CARC) or convey information about remittance processing. Use of X12 CARC codes require a license. Reference https://x12.org/codes/. RARC codes are available at http://www.wpc-edi.com/reference/codelists/healthcare/remittance-advice-remark-codes.

copyright.value: CARC codes are owned, maintained and distributed by X12. The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) maintain Remittance Advice Remark Codes (RARC) used throughout the US health care industry.

description.value: Indicates whether the plan adjudicated the claim as a brand or generic drug. NCPDP field # 686.

copyright.value: NCPDP codes are available by subscription at ncpdp.org. As HL7 is working with the owning authority to finalize the url, this url is subject to change.
